item.title: Manage AWS IAM Secrets using the Vault Operator
item.description: New to KubeVault? Please start here. Manage AWS IAM Secrets using the Vault Operator You can easily manage AWS secret engine using Vault operator. You should be familiar with the following CRD: AWSRole AWSAccessKeyRequest AppBinding Before you begin: Install Vault operator in your cluster following the steps here. Deploy Vault. It could be in the Kubernetes cluster or external. To keep things isolated, we are going to use a separate namespace called demo throughout this tutorial.

item.title: Mount AWS IAM Secrets into Kubernetes pod using CSI Driver
item.description: New to KubeVault? Please start here. Mount AWS IAM Secrets into Kubernetes pod using CSI Driver Before you Begin At first, you need to have a Kubernetes cluster, and the kubectl command-line tool must be configured to communicate with your cluster. If you do not already have a cluster, you can create one by using Minikube. To keep things isolated, this tutorial uses a separate namespace called demo throughout this tutorial.
